reviews.review: PURTY AND GOOD
Never played a Bioshock game before or reviewed any game but this game is definitely worth it.. and usually I hate games like this.

Solid 8/10. It went a bit fast, and the gameplay itself wasn't overly challenging. But the story was great; very engrossing and it made the game. The graphics looked very good; a good transistion between areas and the large scale backdrops looked gorgeous.

A boring waste of a game. 

Like so many others, I really enjoyed Bioshock 1. The immersion and atmosphere is second to none. Coming into Rapture after a plane crash, seeing a destroyed city, a broken utopia. Splicers scrounging around for scraps, addicted to their over use of plasmids and how they effect the body. It really felt like another world. With each new plasmid felt I was one step closer to their level, one more step away from humanity. 

I started Infinte with such wonder, I couldn't wait to see this new world that was built. Seeing the first building float in and connect to the street with a sign "Open from X time to Y time" I though to my self: Well that will be a cool game mechanic, having to wait and plan my actions based on the schedule of locations. I sure was wrong about that one.

I continue on and see a mechanical horse and a handyman, those should be interesting fights I figured.  I wonder how they will handle plasmids in this game. With such strong religious overtones there is no way they will just flat out give you God like powers. Such a emphaisis on control as well, maybe these rebels and this "False Shepherd" who I assume will be me, come up with plasmids ( Vigors i know ) as a act against such oppression by gaining godlike super powers. 

Oh whats that? Vigors are not only on every counter everywhere, but they just flat out give me one at the start? One that allows me to control people and machines? They will then kill themselfs after? And no one else but me and a few enemies use them, even though you practically trip over them around every corner? Well thats pretty dumb.

I then come across the first "shock" of the game, a very lame attempt at racism. Do I hit the white guy? Black girl? Or the host? Oh doesnt matter everyone is shooting me now. Cool, I got a sky hook, why doesnt everyone have one of these? Seems pretty use full. But so are these Vigors that are everywhere, yet no one uses them.

Oh whats this Order of the Raven, sounds 2spooky4me. Why is all this food rotting? Oh i bet something crazy happened here during a feast. Looking forward to digging into this story. "Protecting our race", oh its a racist group, and they are having a meeting. Maybe they will try and get me on their side, give me some big speech or something. I should go down and now they are all shooting at me for no reason. I can now shoot crows at people so thats something. Who thought that would be a good idea for a vigor? To shoot crows. More like the Order of the Boring.

Every level is pretty much that same Order. Some what interesting premise that gets phoned in. Oh you think Songbird is going to stalk you like a hunter trying to get Elizabeth back? Lol nope. Hoping for some cool stories and memorable boss battles? Lol think again. For a game that was ment to seem so open and Infinite it sure felt very rushed and linear. 

What really caused me to put down the game for a long time was Finkton. Here I am walking around loaded with guns and god powers and no one seems to look twice. That is until I step on someones ship, or cross the wrong invisable wall and then all hell breaks loose. Or im tasked with getting a bunch of guns for a revolution. Why dont they pick up the hundreds of guns and ammo thats just laying around on the streets? Why dont they just catch people on fire with the Devil's Kiss bottle thats on every table. 

There is no logic in this game. There is no story. There are no interesting characters. Its as close to a on-rails shooter as one can get. Everything felt so linear and boring. Even writing this review bores me. It reminds me of Bioshock Infinite.

Good:
+ Elizabeth isn't useless.
+ The idea is cool

Bad:
- Elizabeth just so happens to find the one thing your low on.
- The idea was wasted.
- Its so linear and boring.
- No memorable characters.
- The feeling of wonder left quickly.
- The Vigors are dumb.

My opinion... it's a masterpiece.

This game definately had a great story, great graphics, great atmosphere, and everything mentioned in the positive reviews.
However, I just didn't get into this game. The story and the gameplay (personally) did not pull me in to the game. I mean, why not just jump off of Columbia with parachutes with Elizabeth!
But that's just me. I'm just warning you that the story is good, but it might not be as action-oriented as you may think it may be. (I'm all about action. YES I KNOW THIS ISN"T WHAT THE GAME IS ABOUT) :3
By no means, I am not hating. It's a great game. It just wasn't iteresting to me that's all

Bullet sponge linear hall way shooter with sub par fps mechanics. There are no bosses, half of the plasmids are the same thing, two weapon limit and no way to swap out weapons from vendors just have to find them in the game, the perks system was scrapped and now exists as the scraps they left in the game they forgot to take out, the plot is damsel in distress and the narrative is murder hobo blood bath time in white america floating utopia guilt trip white shaming,

Only get it on sale if you must, otherwise I paid 60 bucks for this at launch and I would regret the purchase if I didn't get xcom enemy unknown for free as a pre order bonus as that game is WAY better in general.

Lo mejor:
-Argumento muy bien hilado, que te mantiene en vilo hasta el final.
-Elizabeth. Prácticamente lleva todo el peso de la trama, y por ello, su nivel de detalle y gestos parecen sacados de una película de Pixar.
-Tónicos (poderes) muy divertidos de usar que influyen directamente en tu estilo y experiencia de juego.

Lo peor:
-Lineal, muy lineal.
-Las buenas y malas acciones no influyen en el desenlace.
-Escasa rejugabilidad.

Graphisme vraiment aboutis avec des effets dans tous les sens. Histoire interessante avec des rebondissements qui pimentent l'histoire.

Malgré tout cela je suis obligé de reconnaitre que ce jeu ne mérite pourtant pas tous les honneurs qu'on lui a donné.
Tout d'abord il est très linéaire, et on comprend vite le mécanisme baston/histoire/baston, qui fini par manquer de surprise. D'autre part, le héro est plutot antipathique, voire parfois peu crédible, et j'ai vraiment eut du mal a rentrer dans le personnage.

Finalement je m'attendais à un peu de subilitié là où il s'agit finalement d'un (très bon) blockbuster.
Donc les amateurs d'actions ne seront pas déçus... Les autres préfereront Bioshock 1, beaucoup plus équilibré et jouissif !

This is the first game I played of he Bioshock trilogy. I say that only because my expectations were not colored by the original Bioshock (which I immediately played as soon as I finished Infinite).

The generic dark-haired grizzled protagonist (sort of) Booker Dewitt was refreshingly not-silent. He actually has a history that is important to the story and is relevant to what is happening in the game (....uh, in a way--hahaha). I found his interactions with Elizabeth to be surprisingly realistic--given how most of these Escort Relationships seem to go. Elizabeth was kind of annoyingly arrogant at first--but after she realized that things have gotten bad and she's gonna have to grown up fast--she chills out. I found their dynamic more interesting than I expected. 

Of course, I think it helps that Elizabeth endears herself to the player by not being useless. Typically Escorts are useless, they whine all the time, can't heal themselves and can't use weapons--I have intense resentment for them because they are not fun. But here, Elizabeth keeps out of the way in combat, she can't be injured so you don't have to worry about her. She helps you scrounge up supplies, even. She's USEFUL. And I found myself getting emotionally attached to the two of them (which was why the DLC of them in Rapture was kind of a disapointment). 

And then of course the ending happens and blows your mind and I'm left with all this conflicting emotion. This game is story-rich and I LOVE that. I have replayed this game a dozen times, easily. And I love it just for the story.

And then along with the story---the gameplay is really fun! I LOVE the combat system in this game. It's great! It's balanced, it's got fun Vigors, the melee weapon is cool, the sniper rifle makes me feel like a badass. I love the magnetic shield thing (I always mack that out first).   It's challenging but not rage-quit inducing. Cause that's when a game stops being fun. 

So for me, I was seeing everything--with the gorgeous graphics and settings--without knowing I was looking at references to Bioshock. I knew about Big Daddies and Little Sisters---because my first thought was Big Daddy....Booker Dewitt--I wonder if that was intentional? But otherwise--I didn't know a whole lot.

So when I finished, I was pumped to play Bioshock--and I loved it (though it is extremely unforgiving while you're learning how to play). And then when I went back to Infinite--I started catching things that I had missed. I love exploring the world of Columbia and Im always looking out for things I missed in the previous playthrough. There's TONS of replay value. 


So I love it. Is there anything I don't like?

Well....I found the portal travel a little disconcerning. Because leaving their own universe kind of brings up the question of what matters if they can just take off. 

And then DLC in Rapture---I was so excited for! So....it was kind of a dissapointment how Elizabeth treated Booker during the first DLC. Which brings up--if you have no knowledge of what you've done--are you still guilty? Do you deserve to be punished? For Elizabeth, the answer is yes--brutally. And then in the second DLC, Liz returns for some girl that the audience doesn't know and has nothing invested in. I thought her 'delusions' of Booker were very telling and sweet and very emotionally engaging (and I was curious about how her delusions might relate to the sterile, weird version of Paris at the beginning). It just would have been nice to see some of that in the first DLC. 

Also, the silliness of Elizabeth not wanting to kill splicers? That was stupid. What would be the point of that? Why knock them out with a crossbow---so that they can wake up later and try to kill you again? That was just dumb. Just because she's female doesn't mean she's an idiot.

The character of Sally was also so disjointed from the two characters I was actually invested in (Booker and Liz) that at the end of DLC 2, I thought that I must have missed something. Because all this crap for a child who was basically already dead--what did it matter? 


So, get Bioshock: Infinite--get the season pass for extra weapons and gear.....but--the novelty of the DLC wore off fast for me. So go watch a Lets Play on youtube first. It was so awesome to see Rapture before the attacks--but the story was mediocre.

Великолепная игра, отличная история!
Если вы любите пострелять, побродить по большим локациям и вам нравятся игры с сюжетом, вы никогда не пожалеете, что потратили время на эту игру. Даже если вы не играли предыдущие части, это ничего не меняет)

Кстати, Season Pass тоже советую поиграть. Там уже другая история и другая Элизабет...

Однозначную оценку игре дать сложно даже мне, человеку, играющему в эту серию впервые. Я не разделяю дикие восторги и судорожные подергивания восхищения, с которыми многие описывают Биошок, хотя там действительно много интересных моментов, которые трудно найти в других играх. Здесь много захватывающего и интересного, однако для меня это игра явно на один раз.
Из плюсов  -  это, конечно же, замечательная графика, отличная детализация, проработка игровых моментов и потрясающая винтажная атмосфера, которая пронизывает плоть игры. Сюда можно добавить хороший набор трешевых историй, которые в сравнении с изначальной идиллией города выглядят особенно неожиданно, и оттого неплохо доставляют. 
Минус  -  однообразный геймплей, чередующиеся локации, похожие между собой настолько, что в какой-то момент перестаешь замечать тонкости игры и сюжета; также вид от первого лица (но это уже личные заморочки) и скучные враги. Автосохранение без возможности выбора выбешивает однозначно, и не дает возможности получить удовольствие от процесса. 
В остальном Биошок  -  это хорошая возможность погрузится в нетривиальную атмосферу и полюбоваться работой геймдизайнеров. Наверное, этого достаточно для того, чтобы рекомендовать его как красивую игрушку для проведения свободного времени.
Il est bien mais déçu par rapport au 1. On ne peut pas éviter le conflit: c'est bien plus bourrin que le premier.

Teil angespielt ca 10 Stunden, danach hab ich es einfach nichtmehr ausgehalten und musste (es hieß ja überall Bioshock Infinite ist so ein Hammer Spiel) einfach mal Infinite antesten, und ich war so begeistert ich konnte es nichtmehr aufhören. Nun nachdem ich es durchgespielt habe will ich garnichtmehr 1 zuende spielen und 2 anfangen denn ich weis es kann garnichtmehr besser werden wie der Infinite Teil :D 
PS: Wer sich immer schön umschaut und auch abundzu wo durchrennt kommt auf eine Spielzeit von etwa 20-23 Stunden :)
Ein Contra hab ich doch aufzulisten, man sieht seine eigenen Füße nicht :o

Edit: Teil 1 und 2 noch durchgespielt und ich muss sagen... Alle Teile sind einfach der Hammer! Tolle Atmosphäre und geniale geschichte! 
--- Ein Kauf-muss auf jeden Fall! ---

How to start???

Disclaimer:
This game is good but lacks the feel of Bioshock. If you have never played any of the Bioshock games then ignore this. If you a massive fan of the Bioshock franchise then keep this in mind. I personally love the Bioshock Franchise including this game but I do feel that it is different to the first and second one.

This game is absolutly fantastic: the graphics are amazing (while also not punching a hole into your graphics card), the atmosphere is vibrant, and the action is exhilarating.  Trust me when I say that this is by far the best purchase I have ever   made on steam and i'm currently running the game on a laptop having to play on lower graphics (still waiting to play on higher graphics). You will not regret this game, although lacking in side missions, it does have a campaign that you (or at least I haven't) won't get bored playing over and over again. This games storyline is amazing, its really clever and one that you wont see coming (well, I didn't).

The game's Vigor system allows the player the ability to take out enemies with their prefered playing style by combining vigors or just strategically using them (for example, placing traps on enemies walk path). Then combining vigors with the different guns can then change everything.

The game's main DLC(s) allows the player to return to Rapture which Bioshock fans will love, the only Con to this is somehow there are hooks (like the sky hooks) in rapture which makes little sense.

The only Con to this game is that it does lack the Bioshock feel to it (dark and scary). Songbird is the only thing that links to big daddies but he only appearing in cut scenes. 

To summarise this review...Buy the game.

Офигенный полу-интерактивный фильм, с неожиданной концовкой. Последнее сражение тоже очень кинематографично сделано. Но больше ничего ждать не стоит, просто кино от первого лица. Фантастическое. Глубины сюжета тут особенной тоже нет.

Экшен замечательный и живой, кидающая патроны/аптечки в разгар боя Элизабет это очень впечатляет. Я, возможно, слишком древний геймер, но когда я увидел, как она прячется за колонну/приседает за забором, а потом перебегает в другое укрытие, когда надо, я офигел.

Rapture chapter is over, we have now a new and exotic floating city called Columbia, with the gringos sacred fathers playing a special role. The mechanics of Bioshock are here, but the special attributes have new names and different origins.  But a new and very special element is added: Elizabeth. Your character has his own personality and has as mission find her. She will accompany you (even grow as a person) and will give you a supports in battles, she truly is special and will make all the experience so different than the previous two games. The history, at first seems odd, similar to the first game, then will begin to grow and in the end will make quantum jumps, in short words: Very good and unique history.  From the 3 games, this one is my favorite. Graphics and voices are very well worked, the battles go from very good to a little harsh but enjoyable.

Bem, se há uma franquia que prima por um game bem feito, é Bioshock.

Bioshock Infinite se passa antes dos eventos de Bioshock 1 e 2. Vc é um cara chamado Booker que tem uma dívida para pagar com um casal de irmãos e o faz indo atrás de uma adolescente chamada Elizabeth, que passou toda sua vida confinada numa torre pelo seu pai chamado Comstock.

A cidade é outro show à parte, é uma cidade voadora e Comstock é tipo um profeta que manda nela. Entretanto, de alguma forma Comstock sabia que Booker iria aparecer para levar Elizabeth e num dado momento, os policiais da cidade percebem quem Booker é fazem de tudo para detê-lo. E com eles atrás de vc, vc tem q dar um jeito de pegar Elizabeth e quitar sua dívida.

Isso pode parecer simples demais para uma história, mas não é. Na verdade, a história de Bioshock Infinite é bem complexa e mesmo jogando 2 vezes, tinham vários pontos que eu não entendi e só fui entender depois de assistir um vídeo comentado do Sidão Games.

Os gráficos são simplesmente lindos, história bem complexa daquelas q vc termina o jogo e ainda fica pensando tentando entender o jogo. Vale a pena comprar com certeza.

The story is emotional and fun. The atmosphere is colorful and dark. The gameplay is swift and fun, complex and changes quickly. The ability to not only use guns, but use portals and also a wide variety of Vigors that are as customizable as the guns that shoot bullets. 

An ability to swing around the large combat areas can leave you breathless as you feel like Errol Flynn swinging from ropes and flying through the air. So much fun. 

The game left me with tears the several times I've beaten it. Several times on console and a couple more on Steam. (looks much better on Steam).

Be sure to seek out all the Voxophones and see all the sights you can. There's a lot out there for you to enjoy.

Definitely a sideways step from the original Bioshock; this is the kind of game developer's should shoot for when making a sequal. You can tell it's related to Bioshock, but it doesn't beat the hell out of the same things that made the original great. Absolutely worth the buy, the storyline is attention grabbing every step of the way, and the twist at the end is completely unforeseen. One of the best games I've played, ever.
The best story in game I have ever played!

A man and a girl

They fly like leaves in the breeze

Coming from the sea.

***
~haiku review #14
Very good game with a great story and a great ending, but I had to repeat it 3 times to fully understand it. Amazing art style and setting.
